Debit balances seems to be a good predictor of incoming bear markets or bull markets, according to this index I have been working on. 
"Winter is coming / Summer is coming" 
 
Not good enough for pointing to real tops and bottoms (rough data is released by FINRA with 1.5 months delay), but it paints a good picture of what could come from economy in the mid-long term. 
 
According to this proxy, we could have seen the top+decline of the blue area already in mid 2022, alerting us for a risk correction in financial markets. 
On the other side, the YoY change of Debit seems to be bottoming right now. 
Maybe "summer is coming".😂

Reading traders' posts on StockTwits, there are plenty of them claiming they have predicted this drop.
Maybe some really have.
But if they have been right this time, how many times have they been wrong?
Can we see a score table with all their calls?
Were they right most of the times or just 50%, as flipping a coin?
How much do they make as annual yield on a long strike of trades?
We don't know.
What we know is that the HST mostly ignores these daily moves, and tries to catch the bigger trends, most of the times getting them, and offering remarkable yields.

Full awareness of the huge risks and money management.
In my experience, I prefer to replace the "B&H" with a strategy stepping aside during bear markets and big corrections.
Note that a (hypotetical) $TQQQ would have suffered from 03-2000 to 03-2009 a -98%, and would have recovered back the previous high of 03-2000 only in 11-2019.  It is 19,5 years to see your money back...

Buying & Holding leveraged ETFs like $TQQQ or $UPRO was a great opportunity in 2010.
But when looking at wider picture, you realize the tremendous risks involved. 
Need a strategy to avoid the disaster during big corrections or bear mkts.

@verap The position of the modle is published on ST after the close of the markets. What happens when the model shifts from one position (i.e. AL) to another (say ML)?
- The first option is that the following day, at the opening, traders sell the AL position ($TQQQ or $QQQ) and buy the ML position ($UPRO or $SPY)
- The second option is to be a member of our Telgram Channel, where I alert the investors in real time about what to do in the final hour of the previous day.

There are few days when this happens, so there is not much difference.
Also consider that the "barometer" tells the investors how far we are from a possible shift. When it is <10% I write it and alert the investors.

These services are all free for now. I want to test the model and communications for some months.

@mohawkman2 in the HST model we do not use $SQQQ because
1. market has a gigantic bias: it goes up over long time. So being 3x short is very dangerous. We prefer go 3x long in bull markets (which are longer than bear mkts)
2. Even when HST model indicates a bear market is running, we suggest investors to go Cash or 1x short ($PSQ only in aggressive variants). The reverse 3x ETFs have mortal decay over long time. Your capital can be destroied in the time you are waiting to be right.
3. We run simulations of our model (variant 1) using 3x Short as $SQQQ in bear markets, instead of $PSQ: the average yiels was slighty better than going cash, but max drawdown became 82% instead of 57%
